title: Practice Challenge
description:
You'll work with this HTML structure:

Welcome

Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the heading element (use document.getElementById) 2. Finds the button element 3. When button is clicked, change heading text to 'Hello, JavaScript!'
instructions:
You'll work with this HTML structure:

Welcome

Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the heading element (use document.getElementById) 2. Finds the button element 3. When button is clicked, change heading text to 'Hello, JavaScript!'

hints.text: Inside the click function, use: heading.textContent = 'Hello, JavaScript!';

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Forgetting quotes around IDs:
   document.getElementById(heading)  // WRONG - thinks heading is a variable
   document.getElementById('heading')  // CORRECT - string literal

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Running JavaScript before HTML loads:
   <script>document.getElementById('myButton')</script>
   <button id="myButton">Click</button>
   The script runs before button exists! Put scripts at end of <body>
